comment.author: 68512117@N02
comment._content:
B-24J-25-CO  42-73249   14AF  308BG  374BS
Shot down by US Navy F4U Corsair fighters from the aircraft carrier Essex while on patrol over the South China Sea on 12-Jan-1945. The Navy pilots claimed the B-24 was unmarked. The Navy planes menaced other 14AF B-24s that responded to SHOOTIN' STAR's distress call.  Ten crewmen, KIA:
Pilot               1st Lt. Robert E. Churgin
Copilot           2nd Lt. John M. Carmody
Navigator       2nd Lt. Saul Furman
Bombardier    2nd Lt. Roland W. Wilkin
Engineer        T/Sgt. Charles E. Cytlak
Radio Op       T/Sgt. John Perla
Gunner          S/Sgt. Theodore Jolley
Gunner          S/Sgt. Albert D. Jones
Gunner           Pfc. Raymond L. Peterson
Photographer Sgt. Clifford A. Lask
